overview: A dynamic, data-driven portfolio designed to distinguish a fresher from the crowd. Unlike static templates, this site uses a JSON-based content architecture to serve as a centralized CMS for my projects.
problem: Most student portfolios are static HTML files that are hard to maintain and lack interactivity. I needed a platform that demonstrated my ability to handle data, manage state, and build polished UIs without relying on heavy frameworks like React.
solution: I architected a Flask (Python) application that separates data from presentation. The frontend uses Jinja2 templating with a glassmorphism design system, while the backend handles routing and SMTP email dispatching.
features: Dark/Light mode with local storage persistence
AJAX Contact form with rate limiting and validation
Responsive Glassmorphism UI using CSS Grid

challenges.title: Responsive Grid
challenges.desc: Designing a CSS Grid system that handles mixed aspect ratios seamlessly across devices.

challenges.title: Theme State
challenges.desc: Using local storage to persist Dark/Light mode preference without visual glitches.

overview: FamilyConnect is a private social networking prototype built to simulate the core architecture of platforms like Facebook, but optimized for close-knit family groups.
problem: Public social networks sell user data and lack privacy. Families needed a secure, isolated platform to share memories without algorithmic interference.
solution: I developed a monolithic Flask application with a normalized MySQL schema. The system uses session-based authentication, Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), and server-side image processing to ensure speed and security.
features: Feed System: Create, Read, Update, Delete (CRUD) posts

challenges.title: Database Normalization
challenges.desc: Designing a schema that efficiently links Users, Posts, and Comments while maintaining integrity.

challenges.title: Image Optimization
challenges.desc: Implementing Pillow (PIL) to compress images on the server before saving to disk.

overview: A collaborative task management hub designed for academic teams. Workplace helps students track project progress, share documents, and manage deadlines in one dashboard.
problem: Student group projects often fail due to fragmented communication across WhatsApp, Email, and Drive. We needed a single 'Source of Truth'.
solution: I built a role-aware system (Admin vs Member) using Flask. The app features a Kanban-style task tracker, a central document repository, and real-time status updates.
features: Kanban Board for task tracking (To-Do, Doing, Done)
Team Member management and invite system

challenges.title: Role-Based Access
challenges.desc: Writing custom Python decorators to restrict sensitive routes to Team Leads only.

overview: A high-performance implementation of Tic Tac Toe featuring a custom-built AI opponent using heuristic algorithms, rendered with Python's Turtle graphics engine.
problem: I wanted to understand the math behind game states and how computers 'think' in zero-sum games, rather than just building a simple CLI tool.
solution: I wrote a custom rendering loop using Python Turtle. The core highlight is the AI opponent which checks 8 winning conditions and blocks player moves dynamically.
features: Smart AI that blocks player wins
Score tracking and game reset functionality

challenges.title: Game State Logic
challenges.desc: Writing the algorithm to efficiently check all 8 winning conditions after every single move.

overview: A comprehensive digital portal for the Computer Science department, digitizing the traditional notice board and providing a CMS for faculty members.
problem: Critical information about exams, schedules, and seminars was often missed because it was only posted on a physical wooden board.
solution: I developed a multi-page responsive website with a custom CMS. Faculty can log in to upload PDF notices, while students get a mobile-friendly news feed.
features: Admin Panel for uploading News & Events
PDF Viewer integration for exam schedules

challenges.title: Legacy Support
challenges.desc: Ensuring the site functioned correctly on older university lab computers using progressive enhancement.

overview: A desktop automation tool built to batch-process images, applying transparent watermarks to hundreds of photos in seconds.
problem: Photographers and content creators waste hours manually watermarking images. Online tools often reduce quality or add their own branding.
solution: I built a native GUI application using Python (Tkinter) and Pillow. It performs pixel-perfect alpha compositing to blend watermarks without quality loss.
features: Support for PNG, JPG, and WEBP formats

challenges.title: Alpha Compositing
challenges.desc: Calculating the correct RGBA values to blend the watermark transparency with the base image.

overview: A classic arcade recreation that serves as a study in event loops, coordinate systems, and collision detection algorithms.
problem: Understanding how software handles real-time user input and updates the screen state 60 times a second without lagging.
solution: I implemented the game engine using Python with a queue-based system for the snake's body segments and a grid-based collision checker.

challenges.title: Coordinate Management
challenges.desc: Manipulating a dynamic array of (x, y) coordinates to simulate movement.
